content:
• Monday, July 22, 2013
  • MMTOF

    After opening lower, the Nikkei rebounds, rising 0.86% in Tokyo led by a rally in shares of...

    After opening lower, the Nikkei rebounds, rising 0.86% in Tokyo led by a rally in shares of steel producers. Automaker Mitsubishi Motors (OTCPK:MMTOF) and farm equipment manufacturer Kubota (KUB) lag. Meanwhile, Chinese and South Korean shares rally 1.5% and 1% respectively, while the ASX rises 0.44% in Australia.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 PM
  • CSE

    CapitalSource (NYSE:CSE) and PacWest Bancorp (NASDAQ:PACW) agree to a merger valued at ~$2.3B,...

    CapitalSource (NYSE:CSE) and PacWest Bancorp (NASDAQ:PACW) agree to a merger valued at ~$2.3B, creating the sixth largest publicly-owned bank headquartered in California. CSE shareholders will receive $2.47 in cash and 0.2837 shares of PACW common stock for each share of CSE common stock. CSE +12.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • ARRY

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ARRY +7%. SANM +5%. NAFC +4%. KCG +3%. HUN +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ARRY +7%. SANM +5%. NAFC +4%. KCG +3%. HUN +2%.
    After-hours top losers: NFLX -6%. IAU -3%. AMSC -3%. BCRX -2%. GRMN -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • ARRY

    Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY) is set to report top-line results from a Phase 2 trial of the oral...

    Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY) is set to report top-line results from a Phase 2 trial of the oral CRTh2 antagonist ARRY-502 for allergic asthma tomorrow. A conference call is scheduled for 9 a.m. Shares +7.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.069B (+20% Y/Y) in-line....

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.069B (+20% Y/Y) in-line. Expects Q3 EPS of $0.30-$0.56 vs. $0.45 consensus. Shares -5.6% AH. CC/video talk at 6PM ET (webcast). (shareholder letter - .pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 20 Comments
  • GOLD

    A Chilean indigenous group appeals a lower court decision on Barrick Gold's (ABX +6.2%)...

    A Chilean indigenous group appeals a lower court decision on Barrick Gold's (ABX +6.2%) Pascua-Lama gold mine to the Supreme court and asks it to strike down the project's environmental license. The Copiapo Court of Appeals last week ordered a freeze on construction of the $8.5B project until ABX builds infrastructure to prevent water pollution.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBC

    Shares of Regal-Beloit (RBC +2.4%) enjoy a strong session. Perhaps helping the cause is SA Pro...

    Shares of Regal-Beloit (RBC +2.4%) enjoy a strong session. Perhaps helping the cause is SA Pro contributor Pendulum, who says the post-earnings sell-off in the shares presents investors with an opportunity to capture a 30% upside in the base case and 60% in the "more aggressive case."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • Z

    A short-squeeze or something more? Zillow (Z +8.6%) has taken off to new post-IPO highs in...

    A short-squeeze or something more? Zillow (Z +8.6%) has taken off to new post-IPO highs in afternoon trading, and without any news to account for the move. The company, which reports on Aug. 6, says it has no comment. 25% of the float was shorted as of June 28.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • SKS

    S&P places Saks' (SKS -4%) BB credit rating on watch for a possible downgrade as it raises...

    S&P places Saks' (SKS -4%) BB credit rating on watch for a possible downgrade as it raises concerns about "meaningful amounts of debt" likely needed to finance an expected buyout. In addition to Lord & Taylor parent Hudson Bay reportedly bidding for the luxury retailer, Starwood Capital is said to have made an offer, and Qatar Holding may be interested.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • CLBS

    Shares of NeoStem (NBS +11%) post double-digit gains on above-average volume. Earlier today the...

    Shares of NeoStem (NBS +11%) post double-digit gains on above-average volume. Earlier today the company appointed Stephen Potter Executive VP. Potter most recently served as Senior VP of Operations at Osiris Therapeutics and previously was Senior VP of Corporate and Business Development at Genzyme. (Also: SA contributor Equity Options Guru says "key milestones" should get investors excited about NBS)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • KBH

    Homebuilders (ITB -1.4%) tumble across the board after existing June home sales slipped a...

    Homebuilders (ITB -1.4%) tumble across the board after existing June home sales slipped a seasonally adjusted 1.2%. Rising mortgage rates were supposed to boost short-term demand as potential buyers aimed to lock in mortgages before rates went even higher, but the June report showed no sign of it. KBH -2.6%, RYL -2.5%, MTH -2.5%, DHI -2.2%, MDC -2.2%, HOV -2%, LEN -2%, PHM -1.6%, TOL -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (SKUL +4.1%) rallies after disclosing North American sales chief Richard Sargente is...

    Skullcandy (SKUL +4.1%) rallies after disclosing North American sales chief Richard Sargente is resigning to "pursue other opportunities," rather than relocate to the company's Park City, UT HQ. The disclosure comes a month after Skullcandy announced CFO Kyle Wescoat is resigning "to pursue opportunities closer to his home in Southern California." Given the headphone maker's recent performance, investors might view an executive shakeup as a positive.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 3 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -5.3%) dives as Intel (INTC -1.2%) announces it plans to launch low-power Xeon...

    Mellanox (MLNX -5.3%) dives as Intel (INTC -1.2%) announces it plans to launch low-power Xeon CPUs in 2014 that integrate a large amount of I/O, networking, and acceleration functionality. The chips, based on Intel's next-gen (14nm) Broadwell architecture, are meant to be more powerful complements to upcoming Atom server CPUs. Mellanox investors have already been on edge over Intel's plans to integrate more I/O and networking features onto its CPUs, with the goal of enabling more modular server architectures. The upcoming Atom and Xeon parts will compete with AMD's pending Seattle (ARM-based) and Berlin CPUs, as well as chips from several ARM server upstarts, in a fast-growing market for microservers and other dense/low-power server architectures. (Mellanox acquisitions: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $97 target price, up from $80,...

    Schlumberger (SLB +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $97 target price, up from $80, at Global Hunter after Q2 results beat the firm's estimates almost across the board in its margin performance and announced a dramatic expansion to its buyback program. The firm believes SLB has laid the groundwork to achieve $6-plus in EPS in 2014. Jefferies and several other analysts also raise price targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI +4.1%) is awarded a U.S. government contract valued at as much as ~$38M to provide...

    SAIC (SAI +4.1%) is awarded a U.S. government contract valued at as much as ~$38M to provide joint production, testing and technical services for U.S. Combatant Commands. Perhaps a greater reason for today's advance is a positive Barron's article which says the stock is cheaper than the defense industry average and isn't getting credit for SAIC's faster-growing businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • LEU

    Trading in uranium producer USEC (USU +127.2%) resumes after a pause for volatility, as share...

    Trading in uranium producer USEC (USU +127.2%) resumes after a pause for volatility, as share prices more than double. Strength may be attributable to Japan's elections, after PM Shinzo Abe's pro-nuclear party won a big majority in the upper house. Also higher: URRE +20.3%, URZ +11.3%, CCJ +2.6%. Global X Uranium ETF (NYSEARCA:URA) +3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • LII

    Shares of Lennox International (LII +3.6%) post solid gains after the company turns in a strong...

    Shares of Lennox International (LII +3.6%) post solid gains after the company turns in a strong quarter. Revenue rose 9% Y/Y during the period and adjusted EPS jumped 34% to a record. The company's residential business saw sales grow 16% on margins that were 370 basis points higher than Q2 2012. Residential profits rose 58%. For the full year, management raised its revenue growth outlook to 6-8% from 3-6% and said adjusted EPS should come in between $3.45-3.75 versus previous guidance of $3.25-3.55. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile (NQ +2.9%) makes new 52-week highs after SA contributor and hedge fund manager...

    NQ Mobile (NQ +2.9%) makes new 52-week highs after SA contributor and hedge fund manager Treasure Hunter writes a lengthy bull case. The author claims to have talked with "most of the top holders of NQ," and reports they "uniformly believe NQ is deeply undervalued and should be trading somewhere between $30 - $50 on just the current set of deals and partnerships." He also points out NQ has seen plenty of positive news lately, including a deal with Target and a favorable Q2 pre-announcement, and gives shares a "blended target price" of $44.18 based four different valuation estimates. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • FDML

    Carl Icahn's Federal-Mogul (FDML +24.1%) soars after swinging to a profit in Q2 on cost cutting...

    Carl Icahn's Federal-Mogul (FDML +24.1%) soars after swinging to a profit in Q2 on cost cutting and the elimination of loss-making divisions. Sales in both the power train and vehicle components segments rose 5% Y/Y. FDML also says it raised $500M in a shareholder rights offering earlier this month. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ (OCZ +3.1%) spikes after TheDeal reports the company may be up for sale. Rumors of...

    OCZ (OCZ +3.1%) spikes after TheDeal reports the company may be up for sale. Rumors of Seagate/OCZ buyout talks have popped up a couple of times, but have also been refuted. The recent Western Digital/sTec and SanDisk/SMART Storage deals have led to fresh speculation Seagate or another firm might target OCZ.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • BCRX

    Although it seems difficult to justify the move based on Phase 1 trial data out this morning,...

    Although it seems difficult to justify the move based on Phase 1 trial data out this morning, BioCryst (BCRX +50.8%) shareholders should be aware that the stock is posting rather spectacular gains on more than 10 times its average 10-day volume and is now up some 80% since Thursday.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • BCRX

    Midday top 10 gainers: BCRX +46%. USU +39%. HIMX +37%. FDML +24%. GRH +23%. RDCM +22%. ALSK...

    Midday top 10 gainers: BCRX +46%. USU +39%. HIMX +37%. FDML +24%. GRH +23%. RDCM +22%. ALSK +23%. HGSH +20%. PBM +17%. TROV +14%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OXBT -25%. TOWR -15%. VIMC -11%. AEHR -11%. FMAR -10%. MARPS -9%. DRAM -5%. OTC:PTSX -8%. OXGN -8%. CLSN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +2.7%) pops as a bidding war could be developing. Amgen...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +2.7%) pops as a bidding war couldbe developing. Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) may still bid for the company, reports Bloomberg, with Pfizer (NYSE:PFE), Novartis (NYSE:NVS), and AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) also reportedly prepping their own offers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • SOL

    Solar stocks are having another good day (TAN +3%), possibly aided by project announcements from...

    Solar stocks are having another good day (TAN +3%), possibly aided by project announcements from ReneSola (SOL +9.4%) and bankrupt Suntech (STP +6.3%). ReneSola is providing 63MW of modules from August-October for a Thai project, and Suntech is providing 30MW of modules for a Mexican project set to be completed in August, and deemed "the largest solar power plant in Latin America." JASO +6.6%. SPWR +3.6%. JKS +8.8%. CSIQ +5.3%.SUNE +3.7%. TSL +3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • HRTPY

    Shares of Brazil's HRT Participacoes em Petroleo (OTC:HRTPY -25%) plunge after its Murombe-1...

    Shares of Brazil's HRT Participacoes em Petroleo (OTC:HRTPY -25%) plunge after its Murombe-1 well, the second in its current exploration campaign offshore Namibia, comes up dry. HRT will move the Transocean Marianas rig south to drill the Moosehead Prospect, the third and likely the last well for HRT in Namibia. UBS cuts shares to Sell from Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • TLRA

    After opening higher on underwriter coverage day thanks to four bullish ratings and no...

    After opening higher on underwriter coverage day thanks to four bullish ratings and no neutral/bearish ones, Tremor Video (TRMR -2.3%) has turned negative. Canaccord says it likes Tremor's status as an online video pure-play, and predicts the gap between online video usage and ad spend share will eventually close. Oppenheimer notes Tremor claims every top-10 automaker and 9 of the top-10 consumer packaged goods firms as clients. Shares -18% from their June IPO price of $10.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • DWA

    "Any near term weakness could provide a long term buying opportunity," Janney Capital says,...

    "Any near term weakness could provide a long term buying opportunity," Janney Capital says, reacting to the sell-off in shares of Dreamworks (DWA -6.3%) precipitated by a lackluster opening for Turbo (Stifel called it). Despite the box office bomb, analyst Tony Wible maintains a Buy rating and a $27 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • TOWR

    In addition to reporting a Q2 loss and lowering its FY 2013 revenue estimate below consensus,...

    In addition to reporting a Q2 loss and lowering its FY 2013 revenue estimate below consensus, Tower International (TOWR -14.4%) says an affiliate of Cerberus Capital Management is planning to sell 6M of its shares. TOWR will receive no proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • RDCM

    Radcom (RDCM +18.3%) logs another large gain (previous) as SA Pro's Valuable Insights' bullish...

    Radcom (RDCM +18.3%) logs another large gain (previous) as SA Pro's Valuable Insights' bullish article comes out of embargo. An explosive growth story at a modest price, Radcom could be a $13-$16 stock in a year vs. $4.34 at publishing time (it's $6.18 at the moment), writes VI. Up next as a catalyst is tomorrow's earnings report.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • TEF

    Telefonica (TEF +1.5%) is in "advanced talks" to merge its German unit (went public last year)...

    Telefonica (TEF +1.5%) is in "advanced talks" to merge its German unit (went public last year) with KPN's (OTCPK:KKPNY) E-Plus German mobile unit in a cash/equity deal, the FT reports. The deal is said to have the blessing of Carlos Slim - America Movil (AMX +0.5%) owns ~28% of KPN - and would reportedly result in Telefonica paying €6B ($7.9B) and owning a 50%+ stake in the combined firm, whose enterprise value is pegged at €16B ($21.1B). EU regulators could object to the deal antitrust grounds; Citi thinks it could yield €4B in synergies if it happens. Telefonica Deutschland +6% in Frankfurt, KPN +10.1% in Amsterdam.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX -2.6%) slips despite presenting data which suggests the HSP90...

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX -2.6%) slips despite presenting data which suggests the HSP90 inhibitor AT13387 delayed the emergence of resistance in mice in a preclinical model of mutant BRAF melanoma. The mice were treated with vemurafenib alone and in combination with AT13387. Mice which received the combination treatment did not exhibit tumor regrowth. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • ALSK

    Alaska Communications (ALSK +24.4%) continues to surge thanks to last week's FCC approval of the...

    Alaska Communications (ALSK +24.4%) continues to surge thanks to last week's FCC approval of the merger of its wireless assets with General Communications. SA Pro's Harry Long - who identifiedmassive upside potential of the stock on June 3 at $1.71/share, last Thursday - with the shares still below $2 - said investors were getting a 2nd chance to jump in as the firm had yet to issue a PR on the development (it still hasn't). It's up to $2.97 at the moment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • AEY

    ADDvantage Technologies (AEY +19.2%) flies out of the gate as SA Pro's Nick Ghattas identifies...

    ADDvantage Technologies (AEY +19.2%) flies out of the gate as SA Pro's Nick Ghattas identifies the stock as a classic deep-value play with downside protection, big upside, and a catalyst on the way in the form of either an accretive M&A deal or a buyback program. The article remains under embargo until tomorrow morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • EAC

    Erickson Air-Crane (EAC +8.9%) soars after saying it will acquire Air Amazonia, six aircraft,...

    Erickson Air-Crane (EAC +8.9%) soars after saying it will acquire Air Amazonia, six aircraft, and ground facilities in a deal the company says will be "significantly and immediately accretive." EAC will pay $23M up front and $3M within the first year. The company will also enter into a five-year aerial services contract with Air Amazonia's previous parent company in a deal that should bring in at least $29M/ year in revenue. EAC's last acquisition was criticized by SA contributor Richard Pearson for its alleged connection to ZM Funds' $120M in second lien debt from Evergreen Helicopter. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • BHLB

    Berkshire Hills Bancorp (BHLB -6.1%) tumbles after saying it took a hit from spiking long term...

    Berkshire Hills Bancorp (BHLB -6.1%) tumbles after saying it took a hit from spiking long term interest rates in Q2 - with tightening mortgage origination volumes and margins, impacts on commercial loan and interest rate swap revenues, and higher expenses as integration and efficiency projects were completed. EPS is expected at $0.48 vs. $0.55 consensus. The full report is expected on July 24. KBW downgrades to Hold from Buy. Previous: Berkshire is busy on the acquisition trail.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • XOMA

    Shares of XOMA get a 1.85% bump from the completion of enrollment in a Phase 2 proof-of concept...

    Shares of XOMA get a 1.85% bump from the completion of enrollment in a Phase 2 proof-of concept study for the monoclonal antibody gevokizumab for the treatment of active inflammatory, erosive osteoarthritis. For more, see SA contributor C.R. Jackson's recent small-cap insight piece. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • NEM

    Metal miners is the strongest sector in early trading as gold futures climb as high as...

    Metal miners is the strongest sector in early trading as gold futures climb as high as $1,325/oz.: GDX +4.9%, GDXJ +5.8%, NUGT +15.1%. Newmont Mining (NEM +4.6%) tops all S&P 500 gainers; also RGLD +6%, ABX +5.3%, GG +4.6%, KGC +4.6%, BVN +4.2%, GFI +3.8%. Silver miners (SIL +4.4%): CDE +7%, SLW +5.6%, HL +3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 5 Comments
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +1.5%) may be a new activist target given that its broad portfolio and relatively...

    Textron (TXT +1.5%) may be a new activist target given that its broad portfolio and relatively modest valuation make it a potential restructuring opportunity, RBC analyst Robert Stallard says, claiming a breakup could unlock $42/share value. TXT could generate $8/share from disposing of its Kautex automotive systems, E-Z-GO light transportation, Greenlee test instruments and Jacobsen turf care businesses.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • DKS

    Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +1.7%) gets an opening pop amid an upgrade to Buy at Morgan Stanley,...

    Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +1.7%) gets an opening pop amid an upgrade to Buy at Morgan Stanley, the team noting the stock trades at a discount to peers and has underperformed the consumer discretionary sector despite strong operating results.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • AABA

    Dan Loeb is resigning from Yahoo's (YHOO -3.1%) board at month's end, as will the two other...

    Dan Loeb is resigning from Yahoo's (YHOO -3.1%) board at month's end, as will the two other board members originally nominated by Third Point (Harry Wilson and Michael Wolf); the resignations are said to be in accordance with the terms of Yahoo's May '12 settlement agreement with the firm. Also, Yahoo (via its existing buyback authorization) will repurchase 40M shares from Third Point, after which the firm will continue to own 20M shares (less than a 2% stake). Yahoo now has 7 board members. Loeb has made a sizable profit on his Yahoo investment since originally taking a stake in the summer of 2011. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • JNPR

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) (JNPR -2.3%) has been cut to Hold by Jefferies...

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) (JNPR -2.3%) has been cut to Hold by Jefferies ahead of tomorrow's Q2 report. 2) Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +1.4%) has been upgraded to Strong Buy by Raymond James ahead of its July 31 Q2 report. 3) Nokia (NOK -0.9%) has been cut to Underperform by Oppenheimer following its Q2 results. 4) NeoPhotonics (NPTN +7%) has been upgraded to Strong Buy by Needham. 5) Trimble (TRMB +1.8%) has been started at Buy by Craig-Hallum ahead of its July 30 Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 3 Comments
  • ANV

    In an operations update, Allied Nevada (ANV +4.5%) says its Hycroft mine produced 77.2K oz....

    In an operations update, Allied Nevada (ANV +4.5%) says its Hycroft mine produced 77.2Koz. of gold and 320K oz. of silver in H1, which failed to meet guidance as a result of metals not being released from the Lewis leach pad as expected. ANV expects full-year production and sales of 175K-200K oz. of gold and 900K-1.1M oz. of silver.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • DWA

    DreamWorks (NASDAQ:DWA) -4.6% after Turbo bombs at the box office: the $135M film pulled in just...

    DreamWorks (NASDAQ:DWA) -4.6% after Turbo bombs at the box office: the $135M film pulled in just $21.5M during its open week, making it a distant #3 behind The Conjuring and Despicable Me 2 (out for 3 weeks). Cowen thinks a write-down for the animated racing film could lower its 2013 EPS estimate for DreamWorks to $0.25 from a current $0.72 (consensus is at $0.83). A children's series based on Turbo is set to arrive on Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) later this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 5 Comments

  • Market preview: Gold and silver are having a nice run, but U.S. stock futures are little changed...

    Market preview: Gold and silver are having a nice run, but U.S. stock futures are little changed pre-market, with S&P Mini flat, the Nasdaq +0.1% and and the Dow -0.1%. The latter is weighed down by a 2.7% fall in McDonald's following a disappointing earnings report. Hasbro is -2.5% after its results. With the lack of a major downward catalyst, economist Kent Engelke expects shares to drift higher in the coming weeks. Later: Existing Home Sales
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • MCD

    "This erodes the primary bull case of a H2 acceleration," says Goldman, commenting on McDonald's...

    "This erodes the primary bull case of a H2 acceleration," says Goldman, commenting on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) cautious outlook. "We expect MCD shares to trade off, particularly in light of the meaningfully lower same-store-sales in July to start off Q3." Looking at the expense side, Rahul Sharma notes improvement, with margins off just 10 bps in Q2 vs a 50 bp drop last quarter. Shares -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 1 Comment

  • Indonesian shares (IDX, EIDO) are today's laggard in Southeast Asia, falling nearly 1% on...

    Indonesian shares (IDX, EIDO) are today's laggard in Southeast Asia, falling nearly 1% on weakness in consumer stocks. Elsewhere, Philippine shares (EPHE) slip 0.4%, Malaysian (EWM) equities trade flat, the Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) rises 0.7%, and Vietnamese stocks (VNM) outperform, up 1.4%. Markets in Thailand are closed.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • HIMX

    Premarket gainers: HIMX +30%. NAFC +24%. BCRX +15%. PETS +11%. MUX +8%. SILU +7%. ALSK +7%. CPRX...

    Premarket gainers: HIMX +30%. NAFC +24%. BCRX +15%. PETS +11%. MUX +8%. SILU +7%. ALSK +7%. CPRX +6%. SLTM +6%. RMTI +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • IONS

    Phase II data "solidifies APOCIIIRx as one of the leading value drivers" for Isis...

    Phase II data "solidifies APOCIIIRx as one of the leading value drivers" for Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) Needham's Chad Messer says, boosting his price target on the shares to $36 from $29. Messer is looking for data from a third study late next month.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 3 Comments
  • TROV

    Trovagene (NASDAQ:TROV) says ongoing clinical studies suggest the company's technology is...

    Trovagene (NASDAQ:TROV) says ongoing clinical studies suggest the company's technology is applicable "across a variety of cancer types." The company also announces clinical validation of an assay procedure for the detection of oncogenic mutations in cancer patients' urine. "The … capability to non-invasively monitor a patients' cancer in near-real time may improve … overall [disease] management, leading to better patient outcomes," CEO Antonius Schuh says. Shares +6.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • GCI

    More on Gannett's (NYSE:GCI) Q2 results: Publishing advertising revenue $562M, broadcasting...

    More on Gannett's (NYSE:GCI) Q2 results: Publishing advertising revenue $562M, broadcasting revenue $210M; digital revenue $186M. A significant increase in circulation revenue and higher revenue in broadcasting and digital segments were offset by weaker ad revenue, a ~$10M net reduction in political revenues and an unfavorable exchange rate. GCI -2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • BCRX

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) are up 17% premarket after the company says a...

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) are up 17% premarket after the company says a Phase I trial of the Hereditary Angioedema treatment BCX4161 met all objectives, providing "strong support" for the initiation of a Phase 2a study later in the year. The shares were up over 20% on Friday. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) ApocIII Rx drug, in combination with cholesterol-lowering fibrate...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) ApocIII Rx drug, in combination with cholesterol-lowering fibrate treatment, showed significant reductions of the apolipoprotein C-III (apoC-III) protein and of triglycerides, a form of fat that damages blood, in a Phase II trial. Levels of apoC-III fell by up to 70% and those of triglycerides by as much as 64%, while high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), or "good" cholesterol, increased by up to 52%. Shares +4.7%. (PR)

    Spartan Stores (NASDAQ:SPTN) and Nash-Finch (NASDAQ:NAFC) will merge in an all-stock deal worth ~$1.3B. The combined entity will have 22 distribution centers, 177 retail stores, and will be the country's leading military commissary distributor. NAFC shareholders will get 1.2 shares of SPTN for every NAFC share they own. The deal is expected to close by the end of the year. NAFC +25.84%, SPTN +20.28% premarket. (PR)

  • Portuguese President Anibal Cavaco Silva yesterday ruled out snap elections, saying that the...

    Portuguese President Anibal Cavaco Silva yesterday ruled out snap elections, saying that the coalition government led by Prime Minister Pedro Passos Coelho will stay in office until its term ends in 2015. Silva's announcement came after the Portugal's three main political parties failed to reach a "national salvation" deal. Despite Silva's statement, analysts said the government may fall before the next scheduled election, due to the unpopularity of the Troika-imposed austerity measures. Notwithstanding, Portuguese 10-year bond yields -31 bps to 6.52%, shares +1.6%.

    Shares in Japan (NYSEARCA:DXJ) rise 0.5% after the bloc led by the Liberal Democratic Party of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe wins a majority in Japan's upper house, giving the LDP control of both chambers of parliament. "The removal of political headwinds bolsters the government’s ability to press forward with all 'three arrows' of its growth strategy," says global strategist John Vail. Elsewhere in Asia, Hong Kong flat, China +0.6%, India +0.45%.
